english: first emperor; inaugural emperor; founder-emperor; originator sovereign

etymology.interpretation: Refers to the inaugural emperor, most prominently Qin Shihuang; often appears as 秦始皇 or 始皇帝. Can also be used figuratively for a founder-like sovereign.

examples.chinese: 秦始皇统一六国(秦始皇統一六國)，自称始皇(自稱始皇)。
examples.pinyin: Qín Shǐhuáng tǒngyī liù guó, zìchēng Shǐhuáng.
examples.english: Qin Shihuang unified the six states and called himself the First Emperor.

examples.chinese: 在史书中(在史書中)，“始皇”多指秦始皇(「始皇」多指秦始皇)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shǐshū zhōng, “Shǐhuáng” duō zhǐ Qín Shǐhuáng.
examples.english: In historical texts, “Shihuang” usually refers to Qin Shihuang.

examples.chinese: 在现代语境中(在現代語境中)，称某位开创性的领导者为“始皇”(稱某位開創性的領導者為「始皇」)是比喻用法(是比喻用法)。
examples.pinyin: Zài xiàndài yǔjìng zhōng, chēng mǒu wèi kāichuàngxìng de lǐngdǎozhě wéi “Shǐhuáng” shì bǐyù yòngfǎ.
examples.english: In modern contexts, calling a pioneering leader a “Shihuang” is figurative usage.
